page.title: 17RELIGION
page.content: THE FIRST MENTION OF BOZEAT CHURCH COMES IN THE MIDDLE OF THE 12th CENTURY.IT WOULD HAVE BEEN A SMALL NORMAN BUILDING BUILT OF STONE WITH A THATCHED ROOF.THE STONE WOULD HAVE BEEN LOCAL AND THE IRONSTONE FROM NEAR-BY WOLLASTON.THERE IS STILL A NORMAN ARCH AT THE WEST END OF THE CHURCH TODAY. ALTERATIONS WERE MADE IN THE 14th CENTURY BY EXTENDING OUTWARDS.A SPIRE WAS ADDED DURING THIS TIME AND THE DESIGN IS CALLED A "BROACH SPIRE".OAK PEWS WERE ADDED IN THE 1500's.THE SCREEN DIVIDING THE NAVE FROM THE CHANCEL WAS BUILT AT THE SAME TIME.THE PRESENT ALTAR WAS PURCHASED IN 1894. THE TOWER HAS 5 BELLS THE OLDEST CAST IN 1450.THE CHURCH CLOCK DATES FROM AT LEAST 1700.THE PARISH CHEST,DATED 1686 IS BY THE NORTH DOOR(DEVIL'S DOOR). BURIALS IN THE CHURCHYARD WERE STOPPED IN 1905 AND ARE NOW AT EASTON LANE.
